text:
- [Prasad] Are you tired of
creating data quality rules,
updating thresholds,

and dealing with hidden
data quality issues.
AWS Glue Data Quality has got you covered.
With Glue Data Quality,
you can automatically detect anomalies
and capture seasonal trends,

which makes your job
easier and more efficient.
Let's take a look at how it works.

As you can see, we have added
the data quality transform
right after the data source.

Now, let's go ahead and
enable anomaly detection.
We want to detect issues
with record counts and column counts,
so we will configure a row count
and a column count analyzer.
There are more than 15 analyzers
that you can play around with,
but for this demo, we'll keep it simple.

I have now completed the job
by adding additional transforms

to cleanse and load
the data to the target.
Let's run this job a few times
so that Glue can learn the patterns.

Now that we have run
this job for five times,
let's look at what Glue has learned
by clicking on the Data quality tab.
We have configured two analyzers
that has generated two statistics.
Let's explore the row code statistic

by clicking on Statistics tab
and then select View Trends.

Here we can see three
important information.
First, the trend of the actual row counts.
Second, we can see the trend
Glue has learned from the statistics.

Finally, you can see the
upper and lower bounds
that Glue Data Quality has predicted.

Now let's introduce
some data quality issues

by sending a file with lower
than normal data volume
and removing few columns.

Let's now look at what
Glue has identified.
As expected,

Glue Data Quality has
identified two anomalies.
The clear description tells us why Glue DQ
identified this data as anomaly.

We can dive deeper into the
trends to view more details.

Also, we can copy the
relevant rule recommendations
and easily apply them to our ETL pipeline

so that we can stop our
pipeline from processing
when such issues are encountered.

But what if we want to
exclude certain anomalies
from the model training? No problem.
With Glue Data Quality,

we can train the ML model
by providing feedback.
It's as simple as selecting the anomaly
that we want to exclude.
Then click Edit training inputs

and select Exclude
anomaly from the dropdown,
and then select Save and retrain.

This will exclude the anomaly
from the training data
and adjust the boundaries
to detect similar anomalies in the future.
The ML model is powerful
and can capture the seasonal trends.
AWS Glue learns from seasonal patterns.

And detect anomalies
when there is a deviation
from the seasonal pattern,

you can now combine the
power of machine learning

and data quality rules to
deliver high quality data
for your business users,

enabling them to make
confident business decisions.
Now it's your turn.

Tell us what you think
about this new feature.
Thank you.
